app.ports package¶

Submodules¶

app.ports.embed_port module¶

class app.ports.embed_port.EmbedPort¶

Bases: ABC

An abstract base class for creating an EmbedPort. This class is designed to set an Embed object for the discord library.

Methods

description()

Abstract method that is meant to return the description of the Embed object when implemented in a subclass.

embed_fields()

Returns a list of tuples for the Embed object's fields.

title()

Abstract method that is meant to return the title of the Embed object when implemented in a subclass.
abstract description() → str¶

Abstract method that is meant to return the description of the Embed object when implemented in a subclass.

Raises:

NotImplementedError – If the method is not implemented in a subclass.

embed_fields() → list[tuple[str, str]]¶

Returns a list of tuples for the Embed object’s fields. Each tuple contains a field name and value. By default, it returns an empty list. This method can be overridden in subclasses as needed.

Returns:

A list of tuples for the Embed object’s fields. Each tuple contains a field name and value.

Return type:

list[tuple[str, str]]

abstract title() → str¶

Abstract method that is meant to return the title of the Embed object when implemented in a subclass.

Raises:

NotImplementedError – If the method is not implemented in a subclass.

app.ports.interpolated_port module¶

class app.ports.interpolated_port.InterpolatePort¶

Bases: ABC

An abstract base class for interpolation. This class provides the structure for creating subclasses for different interpolation techniques.

_is_ready¶

A private variable that indicates whether the model is ready for prediction.

Type:

bool

Methods

predicate(power_1, power_2, power_3)

Abstract method that should be implemented in subclass to predict the interpolation value based on the input powers.

train()

Abstract method that should be implemented in subclass to train the interpolation model.
abstract predicate(power_1: float, power_2: float, power_3: float) → ndarray¶

Abstract method that should be implemented in subclass to predict the interpolation value based on the input powers.

Parameters:

  • power_1 (float) – The first power input.

  • power_2 (float) – The second power input.

  • power_3 (float) – The third power input.

Returns:

The predicted interpolation value(s).

Return type:

np.ndarray

Raises:

NotImplementedError – If the method is not implemented in a subclass.

abstract train() → None¶

Abstract method that should be implemented in subclass to train the interpolation model.

Raises:

NotImplementedError – If the method is not implemented in a subclass.
